number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												Defy Gravity: 2D sidescrolling puzzle shooter.The story isn't really important in this game, and it gets covered in the opening sequence before the menu. Skip past it.Where this game comes into its own is the puzzle design. Using "wells" that either attract or repel objects (and only the attractor in hard mode). I found it a bit tricky to get the hang of the rules attached to the gameplay, specifically jump recharging, so here's some advice: Don't hold down the jump button, just tap it when needed.The levels are well designed and provide good challenges, although I did find that the early levels were really easy.I feel that this game requires particularly fine control, so if you wish to get the full experience, I would recommend using a keyboard/mouse instead of a controller (Although with an xbox 360 controller it does work properly).The graphics are not amazing in this game, but they're not bad either. The music in this game is very good, though.As far as bugs and problems go, The screen resolution can only be set by command line arguments, and when played full-screen it didn't fully fill my screen, being surrounded by black bars. Also, *very occasionally*, level elements would not load in properly, prompting the player to need to reload to the last checkpoint.As a puzzle game this is pretty good, and worth  a play, especially at the price it is at.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												Defy Gravity was a game I was pleasantly suprised by. I picked it up for about $0.20 on a sale, and overall, it's a good game.  The game revolves around the use of a gun that shoots gravity wells, the blue gravity well, which attracts things, and the orange anti-gravity well, which repels things. This is a quite fun concept, and is used quite well. Now, if a gun that shoots one of each orange and blue glowy vaguely round objects to progress through a series of puzzles in some sort of challenge course sounds familiar to you at all, that's probably because it sounds a lot like Portal. However, it is actually quite different from Portal. No puzzle has one specific solution, and feels more of a skill-based platformer than a puzzle game. The puzzles are fairly loosely designed, so you can solve them in your own particular style. The game also looks nice, and the music is quite amazing. And after you beat the game, it starts Hardmode, which is implemented in a quite interesting way. Instead of just giving you trickier puzzles or a limited number of wells, it gives you the same puzzles, slightly modified, all enemies are affected by gravity, and you can only use regular gravity wells. This really caught me off guard, because for most of the game, I was using tha Anti-Wells in a sort of rocket jump way to clear the levels. I had to change up my playstyle, and it was kind of cool. However, my biggest problem with Defy Gravity is the bugs. These weren't just small things, they happened every single time I played. When I start the game, I always need to close out of it in task manager and start it again before the graphics will work, and on some levels you need to shoot a gravity well off before the graphics will start, which can get very irritating, especially if there's an enemy nearby. But despite these problems, I enjoyed it. It's creative and fun. If you can pick it up for a few bucks, I say get it. And thank me for not using a Wicked joke throughout this whole review.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												Holy hell if that isnt a tough game. The initial levels took me about 30 minutes to go through but hard mode try an hour and a half. So here's my feelings on the game in 3 catagories...Gameplay:The gameplay is fun and easy to grasp, each level offers a new challange. The early levels are easy but as I got to the last 5 it took a few deaths to formulate a strategy. The gravity gun is a very interesting mechanic, left click fires a blue ball that sucks things in and the right click was an orange ball that pushed things away. I like the idea and would love to see the same concept done in a 3d environment. Overall, the mechanics were smooth and no glitches occured.Graphics:Not really an important part of this game as I'd have been just as happy with 8bit. The graphics are smooth and made for 1080p screens. The animations are basic with very few frames but this isnt really a con to the game. Really I think the artwork done for this game fit the theme and looked rather good for what it is.Sound:The music for this game is rather nice, one moment its calm and relaxing and then in some levels the music speeds up a bit for escape levels. One nice thing I'd like to note is that the sound enemies make when they bounce off of walls is there but not distracting. That I believe is very important and I'm very happy that they were careful about the volume of that ting noise they make.Overall I can definately recomend this game to casual and hardcore gamers alike. 10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												This is a nice short game with a good soundtrack.The concept on which it is based is very interesting, although it could be better implemented. You use your gun to create gravity or anti-gravity wells in order to make your way through the levels.Gravity is hard to manipulate and it can get frustrating to try so many times before succeeding, relying a bit too much on luck with the timings and the hard-to-predict behaviour of the wells.The controls are easy enough (although I had some trouble with the jumping, as it would only jump after I ran off the edge) and, again, the soundtrack is quite good.The graphics, however, aren't the best around, even though I believe the look somewhat agrees with the game. Nevertheless, the game is visually consistent and the space setting is always pleasing.With all that said, I found the game to be nice, but also frustrating and somewhat boring after a while. The good thing, though, is that it is short.All in all, it is a fun, short-lived experience, if you can keep your cool after dying so many times on the same spot because your gravity well didn't pull you well enough. I recommend you give it a try, especially since you can get it very cheap on sale.

content:
Posted: March 21
Morlan's shorts:A little space-suited fella (might be a lass, not sure, I couldn't notice lipstick, lip gloss, eye shadow or eyeliner though. Hm.. a tad much to know about the female appearance! Anyhow just kidding because the info says that it actually is a girl, named Kara) that uses a gravity gun to pull-push objects, avoid lethal robots/lasers/varied baddies and reach the final destination..A seemingly simple run'n'jump('n'gravitate-yourself) arcade-puzzle-ish type of game but with increasingly difficult levels the last of which will require very precise movements, use of all your experience from the early ones and some degree of luck to finish them..The graphics are simple yet nicely detailed and effective in conveying the atmosphere of the game and there's an accompanying soundtrack that's easy to listen and doesn't get too repetitive or boring.Last achievement is quite hard to accomplish and you could reach rage-quitting levels..but in the end it's' worth the satisfying feeling that..you made it!It was one of the first games I bought here and the first one I finished, but I only care about that. Nothing to see here.. keep walkingI give it BFG out of CIA!Final Verdict: Non-roman thumbie: 👍 !Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence!

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Defy Gravity is one of the worst games I've ever played. The idea itself is not bad: armed with a gravity gun, you have to make your way through all kind of (jumping) puzzles. Not enterily original, but still.But. Almost everything else about this game is awful. Sorry for the harsh words, but I find no others means to describe my feelings during playing. Controls are very, very poor, which is disastrous for this kind of game. I played it on an Xbox360 controller, which should be fine, but alas, no.Graphics are even worse - even in the 1980's, games looked way better. Sound is almost non-existent.The only reason I can see to buy this game, is for the trading cards and the xp when you craft the badge. The game is, understandably, very, very cheap, so you can even make a few eurocents if you sell the cards. Oh, there are Steam achievements too, but I gave up after under an hour out of sheer frustration.No detailed rating, but surely only 3/10 or so - and that's just for the cards. Otherwise, it would be even less.

Posted: April 5, 2015
												For now - the cheapest game i've ever seen, cheaper is only a free one.So "pluses":+ A good game for having a rest. + Good musiс set. Though it has only several glees, they remind me the 80th-90th - the songs of space theme improve the environment.+ The game makes you think about your tactics and rapidity, that's why you should strain your logics.+ Short levels and frequent autosaves - that will help you not to break you pc, when you try to handle a level.And minuses:- Sometimes the character doesn't jump, but i don't know whether it is a bug or i do something wrong.- The cost justifies the game itself - rather short, but i don't think that the aim of the game was to involve you for many hours. Just to pass it through once and then play just when you don't know what to do.If you are a game collector - buy it. If you like arcades - buy it. If you like space songs reminding the 80th - buy it. A fortiori that it costs only $0.07 when it is on sale.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												What the hell?! The game is now so much more expensive than it was before!This game is surprisingly good for its former price. Pros: the difficulty is just right: it get's more difficult as you advance, but not to the point that you want to throw your computer against the wall. Cheap. At least it was. It was so cheap that you would actually make money from it by selling its cards! Easy 100% achievements; the graphic sprites aren't great, but are ok;  sound effects and music are satisfying. is not repetitive.Cons: if you have high expectations, this game will be too simple for you; no controls rebinding; not worth its current price; poor interface; one short gameplay and nothing else to do. No extras.For its current prince (BRL 6.29, USD 2.99), I do not think it's worth, but I will say it for my experience with this game, not only actually playing the game, but also considering the price I paid — almost nothing (BRL 0.24, which is USD 0.07): it was worth the value, so I recommend this.

Posted: December 3, 2014
												It's pretty decent game. It looks like Portal clone but there you have gravity gun :pleft mouse button for gravity well (it will attract your character and also some enemies)right mouse button for anti-gravity (same like above but it will repel) / You won't have it in second run (hard mode) so it will be challengingeven colours of gravity affected areas (bound for mouse buttons) are the same like in Portal :pThis game is very easy it takes about 3 / 4 hours (if you fail so much like me ^^) to completely finish it with 100% achievements, also you have a lot of checkpoints. Defy Gravity costs (now) only 0,09€ so it's very cheap.Unfortunately this game is short but concept is interesting.6/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												So Defy Gravity, quite a nice platformer, and I'm very terrible at these -.-. But this has handy mechanic which puts you in control of two wells one is pulling you (and other objects) towards it, the other is pushing you away. This allows for some dodging and jump'n'run action. Additionally you have a shield to protect you from these effects. I liked:++ unique gameplay mechanic+ cheap price (0,09€ in Steam Sale), extremely good value for your money+ challenging but doable, either with try and error or a by planning ahead++ multiple solutions for puzzles+ relatively fast respawnI disliked:- not so good collision meshes- no visual difference, levels are all looking similar to each other, variety would improve the overall experience- story is missing :((((- strange point-and-shoot feature, which requires timing (only when you release the mouse button a gravity well is created)- controls are unchangeable (but there is controller support)At the time of writing this review I did not finish the game once, but I think I may need a total of about 4 hours with my bad skills...I would recommend this game, because of its new mechanic and it is a great game to spent some time.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												So Defy Gravity, quite a nice platformer, and I'm very terrible at these -.-. But this has handy mechanic which puts you in control of two wells one is pulling you (and other objects) towards it, the other is pushing you away. This allows for some dodging and jump'n'run action. Additionally you have a shield to protect you from these effects. I liked:++ unique gameplay mechanic+ cheap price (0,09€ in Steam Sale), extremely good value for your money+ challenging but doable, either with try and error or a by planning ahead++ multiple solutions for puzzles+ relatively fast respawnI disliked:- not so good collision meshes- no visual difference, levels are all looking similar to each other, variety would improve the overall experience- story is missing :((((- strange point-and-shoot feature, which requires timing (only when you release the mouse button a gravity well is created)- controls are unchangeable (but there is controller support)At the time of writing this review I did not finish the game once, but I think I may need a total of about 4 hours with my bad skills...I would recommend this game, because of its new mechanic and it is a great game to spent some time.

Posted: May 14, 2015
												This puzzle platformer is an enjoyable, quick, and (for this generation) hard game. Its achievements, although slightly buggy, are easy and basically the only drive you have to continue. I, personally, found this game fun although at points it got on my nerves because I died over, and over, and over again. However, I know quite a few people who didn’t like it at all so if your inpatient or have lots of good games to play, don’t buy this game. I bought this game on sale for 17 cents and sold its cards for more than that. Yes, you read that right and let me say it again 17 CENTS. It’s really hard to go wrong with a game you earned money by buying. In conclusion, this is a cheap game that’s an easily 100% and is actually quiet fun (for a 17 cent game anyways).

												The game sucks. It really does. The controls are mostly functional, but usually not when you actually need them to be. The game randomly switches to a completely black screen in the middle of play, so you can't continue until you manage to fix it. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												Deviously difficult platformer, that somehow has a hard mode too. This game is frustrating at times, and at certain points sometimes unfair. Especially in hard mode the difficulty skyrockets in the last few levels due to a small amount of checkpoints, and an incredible small margin for errors.That said: If you like platformers, and don't mind trying the same part of a level over and over and over and over and over again until you nail it, this is the game for you.As a plus, this game has a pretty good soundtrack to keep you company while you see the message "Press jump to try again." for the 100th time.It took me almost 6 hours to complete normal mode and hard mode and thus get all achievements. Not bad for a $2 price tag, or even less during a sale.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
												OK, so I bought it with 95% off for 0.14$ only, which is practically free.And yes, I guess that even for the full price of 3$ it's okay, well it is an indie game.But you should know that this game is very buggy, and clearly not test-played well enough, as the levels are far from perfect. Third way through, 0.5 hrs on record, I'm already growing weary of it, as the levels are not as challenging as they are tedious.Now, the concept is good and with a better game design it actually might be a great game: for starters, we should not get all the powers at the first level, but attain them as the game advances. This way it won't be so easy, with so many ways to tackle each obstacle, and it won't have that premature feeling of exhaustion.The way the game is right now, I would recommend avoiding it; it is cheap, but probably doesn't worth your time. I have played many, many indie games over the years and none of them was sold half-baked as this one.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												Controls are unresponsive and all most objects seems to have randomised hit-boxes. This will make you furious and tired of playing this game. I can appreciate a difficult game, but not an unfair one. Defy Gravity Extender have some cool ideas, but the controls and level design just ruins it. It tries to be Portal copycat with some other elements, but it never feels like anything else then a simple school project.The graphics are very simple, but okay. It looks like a web browser flash game almost. The music is, in my opinion, the best part about the game, however it can get repetitive after a while. Only pick this game up on sale if you want trading cards. You can sell the cards for the same price as this game, maybe even earn some cash. Based on gameplay and enjoyment I cannot however recommend this title.

content:
Posted: April 9
												Considering its price tag, Defy Gravity could have been a decent puzzle platformer that lets the player shoot blue and orange points of gravitational pull and repulsion to navigate through the world, a la Portal, if it wasn't for the unappealing graphics and a game breaking lack of screen resolution support. Since the game uses the default desktop resolution, with no way to change it in-game, or even to switch to windowed mode, if a particular resolution is not supported, you would only be able to see a small part of the screen. The developer tried to remedy this by providing batch files that run the game windowed, but I was not able to use them because they refused to see that Steam is running and would just tell me to start Steam first... There is no reason why these settings could not be built into the game menu, and the way it stands now, Defy Gravity is unplayable for those with resolutions over 1080p.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
												If the concept seems really enjoyable to you, go for it! If you're just curious, maybe get it on sale or look for something else.+ Cool idea+ Good learning curve+ Good level design, teaches a mechanic with simple problems before bring up the same problem in with timing.+ Mostly well placed checkpoints on the levels, early on you don't have to redo obstacles you've already handled+ You can almost earn back the money you spent from the two trading cards if the game is on sale.- Won't work before you look for a simple workaround on the forums (developers instructions are unclear if you don't understand what a command line is or how to use it on Steam)- Dull graphics- Poor checkpoint pacing later on; about 40 minutes into the game you spend considerable time getting over large hazard areas and have to redo the whole thing if you die at the last moment- The graphics often get a little jittery, increasing the visual unpleasentness.Overall 5/10, with the technical problems pushing my view into the negative.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												The game feels fine. It's a solid puzzle game. It does the whole "I'm trying to be portal" thing in the first act, and there are a few gripping, quick-paced moments, but it's all ruined by the ATROCIOUS art style. The fun part of an indie game is the simplicity, sure, but when the art style is this neglected, it all feels very sloppy. They even describe the character, when obviously all you need for this game is "You are a dude in a space suit. Have fun." Sure, I got what I paid for at a staggering 0.23 or so USD on sale, but that isn't saying a lot. Hell, the font the WHOLE GAME uses is the default one from MS Word.All in all, unless you just want to waste .30 cents, don't get this game. Play a flash puzzle game instead, those are fun and usually free.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												It's a very good physics-based indie platformer game. Great for wannabe astrophysicists and space lovers. In this game, you've to work your way through the Gauntlet (a space competition) as a female space ninja, Kara, who can bend the laws of physics using Grav-wells and Anti-wells. If you're creative and played games like Angry Birds Space and liked them, you'll like it too! It develops your problem solving and lateral thinking skills because certain levels in the game are quite challenging. The soundtracks are also great and help you to focus on the gameplay. But the game is very short. Newbies may find the latter levels quite hard (some may even have to retry up to 10 times). It's recommended to buy this game on a sale because you can make a profit by selling the card drops as the price drops to $0.14 only!

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												It's a very good physics-based indie platformer game. Great for wannabe astrophysicists and space lovers. In this game, you've to work your way through the Gauntlet (a space competition) as a female space ninja, Kara, who can bend the laws of physics using Grav-wells and Anti-wells. If you're creative and played games like Angry Birds Space and liked them, you'll like it too! It develops your problem solving and lateral thinking skills because certain levels in the game are quite challenging. The soundtracks are also great and help you to focus on the gameplay. But the game is very short. Newbies may find the latter levels quite hard (some may even have to retry up to 10 times). It's recommended to buy this game on a sale because you can make a profit by selling the card drops as the price drops to $0.14 only!

content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
PROS:+ interesting concept+ checkpoint system in the earlier parts of the game+ Steam trading cards CONS:- gimmicky puzzles with enemy objects- bad hitboxes for both your character and enemy objects- Hard mode is just plain annoying without anti-gravity wellsComment:I read some reviews about how this game is challenging and you feel rewarded when you finish it. But after doing normal mode AND the hard mode ... well, I cannot agree. The first half of the levels are great, they are focused of puzzles on how to move forward through the level. The second half is really gimmicky, focused on avoiding enemy objects which actually have square hitboxes even though they are not square. Same goes for your character - Kara. There is no story so puzzles are the only thing interesting here and they begin to be very annoying as you progress. This is even more so in the Hard mode where you do not have anti-gravity wells. Through this the game becomes just gimmicky and not really fun. Also "easy to 100%" is not that easy as you have to beat Hard mode and that is a pure test of will and luck. The reason why I recommend this in the end is mainly for the trading cards...P.S.: I played this game without music because I had to put '-nomusic' in the launcher, otherwise the game crashed. Apparently this is due to Windows Media Player being required which I do not have...

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												Absolutely amazing game. Worth the price. It has the style of portal, without portals. You have a gravity gun (how many volvos am I going to refrence today?) that shoots gravity wells. They will suck you in or push you out- a black hole concept, while trying to get through the Gauntlet. You go through a series of waves of enemies, and if you truly want to put your skills to the test, at the end, there is a hardmode.Pro 1 ABSOLUTELY AMAZING soundtrack. It fits perfectly.Pro 2 Unique game mechanics. I have never seen them before.Pro 3 Nice and cheap, especially when you have a coupon that makes it 74 cents :PCon 1... hmm... hard to think... Short? Sure, why not? I'm sure they'll update it though.8.9/10. Would spend the extra 3 dollars to play it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
												If this game is on sale, it's probably stupidly cheap and well worth at least the trading cards you get from it. It's a fairly short 2-3 hour full game if you're already good at platformers in general and getting a feel for game mechanics, but the music change-ups can keep you around if you're halfway in and might start to get bored. The music gives you a feeling of purpose, with a trippy dreamscape allure, or some such shaite( I dunno man, I'm no critique). I love that the music corresponds to certain level themes, it's what really distinguishes this from some flash game on Kongregate. That, and the good amount of difficulty later on and in the "Extended" portion(basically just hard mode).Overall, keep it on your wishlist and wait for it to cost like thirty cents at the most, it runs very smooth for what it is, so no glitches just dreamy atmosphere, simple game mechanics, and yada yada good things to say about this game.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												This game is fun, but the controls are ridiculously hard to handle and prevent you from really having a good time in later levels.  You have to contort your left hand when playing with keyboard when you want to move any direction after disabling a gravity well or try to press the diectional button as soon as you press a disabling button, and that isnt as easy as it sounds, especially in the later levels where you have to keep pace with a moving platorm and you don't have tie to set yourself up to make the movements.  Aiming is also fairly difficult, becuase the game camera is not always centered on your character, so your crosshair might not be where you want it when you need to use it.  Crosshair style 2 kind of fixes this, but sets your crosshair at a fixed radius, which might not be welcomed by some (including myself).The concept behind this game is novel and fun during the easier stages, but when the difficulty ramps up, you begin to realize just how bad the controls are.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2015
												Defy Gravity is a very interesting game. You play as some astronaut guy and you traverse levels using a "gravity gun." This gravity gun can create portals that attract you toward them and portals that force you away from them. The gameplay mechanics and level design of this game are actually impressive! The game starts pretty easy but near the end some levels are litterally the deepest pits of hell. The "hard mode" of the game, which is unlocked after completing the normal mode, is actually much easier because you don't have to deal with the anti-gravity portals. Anyway, Defy Gravity is pretty fun, and on sale it's definitely worth it! (I got it for 29 cents.)Gameplay: 10/10 (Very fun game!)Dificulty:10/10 (There were a couple levels that actually disemboweled me...)Replay value: 8/10 (I can definitely see myself playing it again! And dying many more times...)

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a platform kind of game.Interface/Menu/SettingsNone.About the game.You are playing with a dude in a white suit in space. He has a gravity gun which will help him across obstacles and other situations. He will get sucked into the gravity ball and goes to the centre of the gravity ball. He also has an anti-well gun where  he will get repelled from. He will get pushed away from the center to reach higher area's. You can also use the gravity shield to protect you from the guns effect.There is an in-game tutorial.Graphics are dull and simple.You are able to use a xbox controller if turned on.You see a small controller manual when pressing esc.Other things.None.-------------------I Give this game a 3/10

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												Absolutely amazing game. Worth the price. It has the style of portal, without portals. You have a gravity gun (how many volvos am I going to refrence today?) that shoots gravity wells. They will suck you in or push you out- a black hole concept, while trying to get through the Gauntlet. You go through a series of waves of enemies, and if you truly want to put your skills to the test, at the end, there is a hardmode.Pro 1 ABSOLUTELY AMAZING soundtrack. It fits perfectly.Pro 2 Unique game mechanics. I have never seen them before.Pro 3 Nice and cheap, especially when you have a coupon that makes it 74 cents :PCon 1... hmm... hard to think... Short? Sure, why not? I'm sure they'll update it though.8.9/10. Would spend the extra 3 dollars to play it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
												If this game is on sale, it's probably stupidly cheap and well worth at least the trading cards you get from it. It's a fairly short 2-3 hour full game if you're already good at platformers in general and getting a feel for game mechanics, but the music change-ups can keep you around if you're halfway in and might start to get bored. The music gives you a feeling of purpose, with a trippy dreamscape allure, or some such shaite( I dunno man, I'm no critique). I love that the music corresponds to certain level themes, it's what really distinguishes this from some flash game on Kongregate. That, and the good amount of difficulty later on and in the "Extended" portion(basically just hard mode).Overall, keep it on your wishlist and wait for it to cost like thirty cents at the most, it runs very smooth for what it is, so no glitches just dreamy atmosphere, simple game mechanics, and yada yada good things to say about this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21
												The core gameplay mechanic of this game just felt poorly tuned.  The player felt slow, and the jumping felt heavy and unforgiving.  If the gravity was less strong, and the player a bit faster, and levels a bit bigger and more zoomed out, it might have been easier to get into.  Maybe I would've felt more in control, and it would've been easier to find the fun in this game.On top of that, the difficulty curve spiked up way too fast.  The game was asking me to commit really hard really early to a platforming mechanic that I'd had absolutely no time to learn and no opportunity to enjoy, so I just gave up.  There may have been some interesting puzzles later on down the line, but the gameplay itself wasn't engaging enough to keep me interested long enough to find out.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												This game is fun, but the controls are ridiculously hard to handle and prevent you from really having a good time in later levels.  You have to contort your left hand when playing with keyboard when you want to move any direction after disabling a gravity well or try to press the diectional button as soon as you press a disabling button, and that isnt as easy as it sounds, especially in the later levels where you have to keep pace with a moving platorm and you don't have tie to set yourself up to make the movements.  Aiming is also fairly difficult, becuase the game camera is not always centered on your character, so your crosshair might not be where you want it when you need to use it.  Crosshair style 2 kind of fixes this, but sets your crosshair at a fixed radius, which might not be welcomed by some (including myself).The concept behind this game is novel and fun during the easier stages, but when the difficulty ramps up, you begin to realize just how bad the controls are.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												When I bought this game for $0.14, I only had the trading cards in mind. What I actually paid for was a fantastic platformer with a very unique and interesting concept to fuel the open-ended movement style: gravity.Pros:+Gravity at the dispense of the player is an amazing concept that the game executes beautifully+Freedom to make it through levels as you'd like: while the levels are indeed linear, the strategies the player can use to traverse them are not+"Hard mode" that extends replayability+It cost me $0.14 manCons:-I finished the game in about an hour and a half; however, even at the full $3 price tag I'd be plenty happy with what I got out of my first time through-As far as I'm concerned, the game has no story whatsoever other than that the protagonist is a woman named Kara with a special ability.These cons mean nothing considering the pros though, and it's a shame to know so few people have heard of this game. I recommend anybody pick it up.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												It's a simple yet beautiful puzzle game that actualy stumped me a few times. It's hard mode is also very impressive, as instead of a standard more enemy HP/time limit/etc, now you can't use anti-gravity wells which forces you to go all ninja everywhere on the map. All the enemies are also now effected by regular gravity wells, so you shouldn't stay in a particular well for very long.Amazingly well thought-out game. Definately buy this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												I can't say that I've finished the game... Yet. I'm about two-thirds or three-quarters of the way through, so I'm fairly close to finishing it.This game, whether you're reading this review during a sale or during regular prices, the game is worth the $3 or $0.29. Now trust me, I looked at the pictures and I wasn't thinking it was gonna be that great since the level design didn't look that good. But I can confirm that it's pretty amazing.I want to point out that in the description it says "Unique physics engine that provides a never before experienced gameplay experience", they're not joking. I haven't really had a puzzle/platformer games have me use both gravity (pull) and anti-gravity (push) fields to complete a level.As of the difficulty of the game, I wouldn't say it's Super Meat Boy level, but it's definitely not any Superfrog HD.But don't forget the music. It may be only two or three tracks, but they're pretty good for a little indie game of this size (Roughly 50 MB).All the music and tiny little bugs and such included, I give this a solid 7/10.EDIT: I've completely finished the game now. I do think that this could have a solid sequel with more levels and I actually look forward to one. I still stick with my 7/10 :)

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a platform kind of game.Interface/Menu/SettingsNone.About the game.You are playing with a dude in a white suit in space. He has a gravity gun which will help him across obstacles and other situations. He will get sucked into the gravity ball and goes to the centre of the gravity ball. He also has an anti-well gun where  he will get repelled from. He will get pushed away from the center to reach higher area's. You can also use the gravity shield to protect you from the guns effect.There is an in-game tutorial.Graphics are dull and simple.You are able to use a xbox controller if turned on.You see a small controller manual when pressing esc.Other things.None.-------------------I Give this game a 3/10

content:
Posted: February 8, 2016



YouTube™ Video: Steam Cleaning - Defy Gravity Extended 

			Views: 7		

			A very humble game, Defy Gravity's clever mechanics and puzzle design are hidden behind weak visuals and presentation. If you can look past a weak first impression the game will quickly grow on you.		

A very humble game, Defy Gravity's clever mechanics and puzzle design are hidden behind weak visuals and presentation.  If you can look past a weak first impression the game will quickly grow on you.Armed with a weapon that creates gravity wells that will retract or repulse you, unless your grave shield is on and a simple jet pack for extra jumping height.  Use these tools to solve increasingly complex platform based puzzles.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												Story: ~5/10 The story is very, very simple. I don't think the developers intended to elaborate on this part. The gameplay is more important. Story not needed.Controls: 9/10 Really fluid. However, to place a gravity well, you click and hold, and a well will be thrown in the direction you clicked. To make the well stop moving, you release the click. This gets rather annoying. as it would be better if the well stopped exactly where you clicked.Graphics: 3/10 Horrid. However, the space backgrounds and gravity wells are okay.Music: 8/10 Creates a nice atmosphere.Difficulty Balancing: 8/10 Good balancing between too easy/too hard.Needed Features:-Slightly better control sceme-Level mapOverall: 8/10 Good for 14 cents

content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												Revision: After playing a little more with this game all I can say is: The Physics in this game are way to unpredictable to be fun. The only reason to get this game is to make money by selling the trading cards when it is on discount. Other than that: Avoid it at any cost.Original Review:Ok, I got this game in the same sale as assumely most people here atm.The game idea itself isn't so bad. You are an astronut :) holding some sort of space-gun. With this gun you can shoot two different types of missile-like projectiles that aim the direction you're pointing the cursor at and explode as soon as you let go the mousebutton.One of the projectiles creates an orb that sucks you in and the other one creates one that pushes you away. You have a doublejump too but you won't get very far in this game unless you master the correctly timed placement of those two orb-type-thingies to drive your player around the different courses.The difficulty curve starts fair and easy and there even is a tutorial at the beginning of the game explaining all the different things you can do. But really it isn't much more as I mentioned before. There are some types of "enemies" though. Some cannot be touched but jumped on and another sort cannot be touched at all. If you do so nonetheless you'll get killed instantly.Sounds interesting eh?Well it is (as long as you can cope with the plain graphics and leveldesign). But there is one major flaw that renders this game nearly impossible to play at higher levels: The physics everything is based on really aren't that perfectly done. I died plenty of times because the player sprite fell through a correctly placed push-orb or didn't get sucked to a suck-orb.And yes this sucks (even without any orb) and so pushes one away from the game way too soon ... Without these flaws it could easily be a nice game because, as I said in the beginning of this review, the core game idea is good. But due to the fact of the imperfect physics I think that most players won't get very far ...But what the heck. All in all you get this game for free because you can always trade in the trading cards and maybe even make a few bucks plus this way. So maybe I'm just a sucker at this game and you will have great fun with it.For the price they're asking right now you should give this game a try if you're into platforming action-puzzlers. At least you can't loose anything in the process ...

content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
												Ugh, this game is alright, I suppose. Definitely not the worst game I've ever played.The controls are horrible, for a start. I kept messing up because instinct told me to hold W, even though that is jump and holding jump is liable to get you killed, because space is also jump, and you can't jump if you're holding both jump buttons.Graphics are Flash-era. The game is too, sort of.The puzzles are... Some of them are easy, some of them are hard, and some of them are just deathtraps to annoy you. Mostly deathtraps. Checkpoints are placed before/after every puzzle, which is nice.However, working with gravity and anti-gravity, well... it's a fun concept, and it was fun at times in this game as well, but due to the fact that most 'puzzles' are just deathtraps with tons of hazards, it's not really that fun.The music is alright, though.Oh yeah, and don't try playing this game with a controller. You need the high sensitivity of a mouse to even attempt half these puzzles.And the dev is fishy, too. Bumping back the release date just so it always appears in Upcoming Titles. Considering the publisher's name, I shouldn't be surprised.(get it? fish factory, fishy dev? ah, forget it)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												Yes yes, You can just buy the game for the trading cards and sell them, That's lovely.However the actual game itself, Isn't that bad. I mean the mechanics are pretty standard, And the time required to actually 100% the game takes just under two hours, But it isn't that bad.This isn't going to be one of the games I recommend to people, But I won't tell them not to buy it either if asked. The price is fair for what it is, And while it's not going to be one of games people spend days passing, Less than a dollar is more than fair for two hours of lifetime.I've read a few other reviews this game is moderately difficult, I didn't find that at all. Granted there were 2-3 areas that took me a couple of attempts to pass, But that wasn't because the area was hard, More of I was impatient and tried something wreckless.This game's fairly easy, But not a cakewalk either. Stacked with the cheap price, You have very little to lose by purchasing this game. Why not buy it?

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												This is what I call a very good game. I found that the later levels are a bit on the hard side but it is still fun. The story is basic but good, the gameplay is rather basic but good as well. GAMEPLAYIt's pretty much like Super Mario with a slight twist.You have a gun that creates gravity wells and anti-gravity wells.The gun helps you through the levels.There are also different ways you can get through the maps as well.MUSICI think the music really matches the game, I give it a 4/5.GRAPHICSThe graphics are basic, nothing earth shareting but still looks good.OverallThis is a great game for it's price.It has very good gameplay, music and graphics.I recomand this game to anyone who wants to buy a cheap game on steam.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												This is the perfect game for people who like everything and are easily impressed. There is some fun and satisfaction to be had solving these puzzles but other people will find them annoying and tedious. And the levels are unpolished. The world of Defy Gravity is not a vibrant world alive with colors and life or amazing artwork. Its a pretty drab place that made me want to kill myself the way it constantly reminded me I was wasting my life playing it.I don't remember the music. I didn't like the controls. I did like the way they didn't keep sending me all the way back to the beginning. If they'd done that I would have actually been mad so I thank them for that consideration. The price was right but I fear that someday soon I'll have a need for that 29 cents. I hope they use the money to buy some talent and good ideas. They are sorely needed.

number of helpful: 10 of 25 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												This is a rather nice puzzle game for a low price, except for one annoying bug. At the start of every level, the screen will be black until you shoot a gravity well. The screen will also become black randomly in the middle of a level if you haven't got any gravity wells out, which can be quite annoying if you're in the middle of a death-defying jump.Needless to say that I can't quite enjoy this game as I should. Until this bug has been fixed (which I understood the dev has been trying to figure out for over a half year now), I can't possibly recommend this game as it's more annoying than enjoyable.To show an example why this is rather annoying... in one of those levels there is a laser beam heading your way, and you have to get to the other end of the level as fast as possible. There are a rather lot of spikes on the floor and you have to jump with a floating platform and time things nicely. Now, imagine jumping with a hot laser beam on your tail and you need to be able to look where you are jumping off to, and suddenly the lights go out for no reason. Very likely you're going to die, and the screen stays black even when you start over. The hot laser beam, however, is still heading towards you in the restarted level and you won't see it until you shoot some random gravity well just to notice you're too late and died again. Rinse and repeat.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												This game is impressively bad. There's a crashing-bug on the first screen unless you use command-line options to force it into windowed mode and disable the music. Once that's sorted out you find yourself in the midst of the kind of "I made this in just 30 minutes" shovelware that you'd expect to see with a low score on a flash games site. (NOTE: THIS IS NOT AN EXAGGERATION.) The controls are poor, the concept is moderately amusing, but very poorly executed. There's no storyline of any sort beyond the opening screen. The graphics are garbage.I felt like I should exercise some restraint in making harsh criticism, since this smacked of "baby's first vidya gurm", but then I got the trading card with the girl showing her cleavage, which I figured would be worth 5 seconds of amusement. Then I clicked on it to see the full-sized version and instead of showing the picture on the card it showed a gameplay screenshot.This is a troll game. Don't waste your time.This game goes on sale sometimes for $0.29 USD. The cards are currently worth about $0.08 USD, and you get 3 of them, so you can get this game for a nickel. It's worth about a dime less than that, though.

number of helpful: 7 of 23 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												Defy Gravity is an action platformer that is a mix between classic platforming and gravity based puzzle solving. Kara, our heroine, has access to a unique gameplay mechanic that she uses to manipulate the world around her. She has a gun that is able to alter the laws of physics through the creation of pockets of gravity and anti-gravity. By mastering the use of these abilities Kara is able to augment her jump in order to almost fly past obstacles. These powers can also be utilized to move objects that block her path and platforms that Kara stands on in order to traverse the levels.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2013
												Defy Gravity is a very short and simplistic puzzle platformer where you create gravity wells that either push or pull you. It's kind of like being in a magnetic suit and the gravity wells act as attractive and repulsive magnets. The gameplay is actually pretty good and the game does get progressively more challenging as you progress, but the early levels only take a matter of minutes to finish. I do like the old school feel to it and the save spots keep it from becoming overly frustrating.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I liked it.It's a very solid puzzle platformer with an interesting concept of little gravity holes that either suck you in or push you away, which of course are used to get from one end of the level to the other. They have names, but I forgot them.There's no story, but I wasn't really expecting one. I believe, though I may be wrong, that you're a heroine named Kara. I think I saw that somewhere anyways. In reality, it affects nothing, and the model for the character is in a space suit, so you can't tell either way. Does that take away from the game? No, I guess not, but it certainly doesn't add anything.I bought it while it was on sale for I believe 29 cents or $0.29, because why wouldn't you pay that much for a game? It took me a little over two hours to complete, both its normal and hard mode (which is unlocked after you beat the game one time) and it was fairly challenging at some points. The problem with this is that the puzzles that were challenging weren't beat by thinking, but by luck. Now, I don't normally resort to blindly going forward and hoping to get lucky often, but there were cases where strategically planning were out of the question; it just couldn't be done. This is more evident in the hard mode, where you will more often than not disrupt the path of flying projectiles to the point where they're completely scattered and flying all over the place.Another negative was that the soundtrack was unengaging. If I wasn't so lazy, I would have muted the game and used Spotify for my audio needs during the game. There are some points where you can go over the top of the level and skip the level mario-style, and I unashamedly used those when I felt as if a simple puzzle was beneath me. Lastly, the game seems to want to point out where exactly to put your gravitymajiggies for a good six or so levels in. That's quite annoying.Despite this, I still rather enjoyed the game, and I did gain a profit from the playing cards earned during the game. It wasn't spectacular, or even great, but it's good enough to not be a waste of time. And if you can net a profit off of it? Sure, go for it. However, if it's not on sale and costs $2.99, then I would look elsewhere.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												At a certain point Defy Gravity warns you that it's about to become very difficult, and it isn't lying!  It's the kind of difficulty where you can see the light at the end of the tunnel and know how to reach it, you just need to hone your skills enough to be able to do so.  You're going to want to want to keep trying, and the designers here were smart enough to know exactly how to encourage that by providing unlimited tries, and a perfect check-point system.  If you've passed a section you won't have to do it again because you died on the next one.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Surprisingly neat! I made my thirty cents (bought during sale) back from the cards too, so an essentially free, decent game is alright in my books.None of the puzzles are extremely difficult, but some of them do require some timing. There's a hard mode after you beat the game that I didn't really try which could get excrutiating if you're adamant about getting 100% achievements. The physics aren't super finnicky like I'd expect, and it works mostly well. It's a hella indie game though and it shows just from the general lack of polish in areas; there were occasions where I died when I thought I shouldn't have. That's not too big of a deal and I'd say this is definitely worth your money during a sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I liked it.It's a very solid puzzle platformer with an interesting concept of little gravity holes that either suck you in or push you away, which of course are used to get from one end of the level to the other. They have names, but I forgot them.There's no story, but I wasn't really expecting one. I believe, though I may be wrong, that you're a heroine named Kara. I think I saw that somewhere anyways. In reality, it affects nothing, and the model for the character is in a space suit, so you can't tell either way. Does that take away from the game? No, I guess not, but it certainly doesn't add anything.I bought it while it was on sale for I believe 29 cents or $0.29, because why wouldn't you pay that much for a game? It took me a little over two hours to complete, both its normal and hard mode (which is unlocked after you beat the game one time) and it was fairly challenging at some points. The problem with this is that the puzzles that were challenging weren't beat by thinking, but by luck. Now, I don't normally resort to blindly going forward and hoping to get lucky often, but there were cases where strategically planning were out of the question; it just couldn't be done. This is more evident in the hard mode, where you will more often than not disrupt the path of flying projectiles to the point where they're completely scattered and flying all over the place.Another negative was that the soundtrack was unengaging. If I wasn't so lazy, I would have muted the game and used Spotify for my audio needs during the game. There are some points where you can go over the top of the level and skip the level mario-style, and I unashamedly used those when I felt as if a simple puzzle was beneath me. Lastly, the game seems to want to point out where exactly to put your gravitymajiggies for a good six or so levels in. That's quite annoying.Despite this, I still rather enjoyed the game, and I did gain a profit from the playing cards earned during the game. It wasn't spectacular, or even great, but it's good enough to not be a waste of time. And if you can net a profit off of it? Sure, go for it. However, if it's not on sale and costs $2.99, then I would look elsewhere.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												As this game has been released for more than three years, I would expect it to have a lot more polish than it actually possesses. There's no facility for adjusting the volume of sounds effects or music, and game controller support is limited only to the Xbox 360 controller. There are so many generic Windows game controllers available, and so many other games seem to have no problem supporting them, it's quite frustrating to find that this game doesn't. The game itself is based on a novel idea, and is quite fun. But the lack of expected facilities makes it lose that "one-more-play" feeling, unfortunately.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Oh well."Defy the gravity!"They said."It will be fun!"They said.Defy Gravity was one of the only games that actually made me quite mad. And I did not expect it. I wont make a long review for it, since it is very short and simple game.Defy Gravity is a little 2D platformer, where the player can make gravity, and anti-gravity wells, and progress through levels thanks to this. You will hear a nice calm chill music in the background, but you might notice that you dont give a single damn about it when you are trying to beat the game. The controls are simple, the game is catchy, but there is A LOT levels that are complete brainfart and require just alot of luck. Mostly the last few levels. But it is worth to play. I got it for 9 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cents on a sale, and I definitely cannot regret it. It is just one average game, but for the price, like please, just buy it on a sale.PROS:+ Simple+ Catchy+ CheapCONS:- Brainfart levels- Short (atleast it did not get boring though)- Last achievement is cancer to get. (Might be a Pro for people looking for a challenge, but I definitelly didnt enjoy it personally.)Anyways, hope you already bought the game, and good luck defying the gravity.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												The game progress from simple to complex in a very rapid pace. From maps that take minutes to those that take hours, this game is rather fun. Of course, your biggest enemy is your patience. Will you throw a tantrum after not gettign to that finish, or will you instead channel your energy to complete your mission the next time?Graphics are unimpressive, but this indie game is more focused on the few simple gameplay mechanics that when combined, give an almost limitless storyline options, and an infinite combination of ways to clear a level.In the end, I would recommend this game for its simplicity; it's a good time waster, so you may find yourself stuck on a level for hours... or days in my case. Yet, it did help me think more strategically and above all, stimualted me to think fast in very time-limited scenarios. A definite 7/10 from me.

It's a relatively short game but it's a fun little brain teaser and is easy for anyone to pick up and play; well worth the price (especially during a sale!).

The art direction isn't much to write about but that's okay because where it shines is in it's gameplay.You can finish the game in less than 2 hours but that doesn't mean that it is very easy. Defy your expectations, enjoy the gravity of fun this game has to offer; extend yourself to this wonderful game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
												I'm sure I took a little bit longer than some folks to fully clear the game and all achievements, but even then it was only at 4 hours, so it's a relatively short game.That being said, it's challenging, occasionally frustrating, and a refreshing change of pace from so many types of platformers, especially since there is a vast array of paths and patterns to adapt and influence in each level, and those aspects are supported by good play mechanics and physics.Replayability is lacking once you make it through on the hard mode, but I wasn't expecting a game I could continue to go back to afterwards, so there's no disappointment for me on that score.At $1.99 regular price, which means it's insanely cheap during Steam sales, there's really no reason for anyone who has even a fleeting interest in platformers to pass on this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												Short Review:You get what you pay for.Full Review:- Gameplay & ControlsDefy Gravity is a simple platformer where you use simple controls (WASD and mouse) and various objects to help you out, specifically one gravity sphere and one black matter sphere. Using these two spheres, you attempt to suck youself and navigate through a simple, and then challenging and later split-second-reaction-time terrains. There are no background story as to why you need to navigate through them or whatsoever, so it's just a linear puzzle game. The controls may feel a bit disjointed at times as you have to mash the buttons or else repeat yourself for a few more times.- GraphicsIt's rather simple and there's not much fancy graphics to it, save the cutscene (maybe). The menu and text are easy to read but also, again, rather simple. The background does not feel matching, et cetera, as you can probably notice from the game's screenshots itself.- MusicIt's simple audio effects as well. Nothing spectacular, distasteful or annoying.- PricingIt's cheap, in fact the trading cards you get costs more than the game itself. The plenty of reviews helps to concrete this evidence.- VerdictThere's no reason to not get it, though if you aren't a fan of these platform-jumping games then there's no reason to get it either. Or maybe you could earn a few cents from selling the trading cards?

number of helpful: No ratings yet

												Fairly simple mechanics, but paired with a difficulty wall that forces the player to figure them out almost instantly or be unable to progress in the game. Several levels require lengthy periods of precise platforming, where a single mistake causes you to lose significant progress.Only worth it on an extreme sale when you can sell the cards for more than you paid for the game. Even then, it's probably more enjoyable to Alt+Tab out and just do something else until the card drops roll in.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2015
												The only reason I picked up Defy Gravity was because its price was next to nothing (75% off on sale, for an already super-cheat game). I came in expecting nothing, since the few things I could find said very little if the game was good or not.I was pleasantly surprised to find a pretty competent platformer with some neat mechanics to it. It certainly has it's flaws, and is rather short. But, it certainly was worth it's cost, and is a pretty fun game if you can see past the rather old-looking graphics.(The trading cards you get from playing also cost as much as the game when on sale, so you get it pretty much for free)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												As my first review, I'm happy to put it on such a wonderful game. Defy Gravity Extended is perhaps one of the best platformers I have played in my life. The challenging levels and the great music makes a great experience to play. The levels go from super easy, teaching the mechanics to difficult levels that require split-second decisions. The graphics aren't Skyrim-esque, however, they fit the simplicity of the game. The gravity wells and anti-wells allow you  to float, hover, and boost yourself across levels. The gravity based platforming really makes this game a wonderful thing to play. I do think the player model can be improved, as it doesn't have much to write home about. I also found a glitch that if you put both a gravity well and antiwell in a corner, and walk straight into the corner, you won't be able to control your character. To fix this, you have to use your gravity shield(makes you immune to the effects of the gravity wells you place down), or place a new well. Overall, I rate this game a 9.5/10, and it would be a 10/10 if the devs could improve the player model and the glitch I have found. I really recommend this game if you want a calming experience, or a challenging game. I think the devs should add in a level-creator, so players can make and share their creations. Once again buy this game, its very nearly perfect.

Posted: January 3, 2016
												This game is absolutely unpredictable, the objects that kill you don't seem to follow the rules that you've established in the game and so they can't be followed by your mind. It is also really confusing how the wells work. The gravity well is supposed to suck you in, but if you go into it at a moderate speed, it seems to spit you back out at the same speed you were going in, and sometimes even faster. It's even worse that once you reach a hard level, you need to get past each section before reaching a checkpoint, and after trying the exact same thing, time, after time, after time, the only thing keeping you from rage quitting is knowing all of the progress you've made before then will be lost if you quit. I got this game for %0.18 and even then, I wish for my money and time back.

Posted: November 26, 2014
												Once I started playing, I couldn't stop. It was like it sucked the soul out of me, and as I spiraled into darkness, all I could see was this game. I spent the whole afternoon non-stop playing this thing!Pros:-SPAAAAAAAACE!!!!-Cool Concept and Ideas (Gravity Gun, Gravity Shield, etc.)-Variety of Obstacles (Lasers, Orbs - You get the idea)-Cheap! (Goes on sale often!)-Fun for its price! (I got 6 hours of entertainment. Game is much shorter than that in length. Played through it a few times)Cons:-Graphics/Animations are pretty bad.-Gets Very Repetitive ("Play every level again on hard mode?" Take my soul, too, while you're at it.)-Overused Mechanics (After so many levels, new elements would be appreciated)I found this game very fun for its pricepoint, especially considering how much cheaper than the actual price I got it at. ($00.24?, dangit, could've got it for $00.14!) I'd rate it around a 5/10 for the genre, but 8/10 for the entertainment value I got out of it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												Feels good at becoming Master Gravitymancer, then realizes that the game just started to get hard...But in all seriousness, this is a good game. Some of the puzzles are pretty straight forward, and some are harder, which is fine because it would get disapointing to beat one really hard puzzle that you died on dozens of times just to realize that you have another one right after it. But some of the puzzles are hard to the point where it takes you dieing tons of times before you actually get past it. It is a fun game though, and at a sale price at $0.30 (might I note that the cards can be sold for around $0.10-0.30 themselves, so, profit?), this is a great small game that can take some time in finishing. The game has Portal feel to it, you get two different gravity "wells" which either pulls or pushes you and/or objects. The gun is somewhat strange, it looks like a old watergun that I used to own, but instead of shooting water, it shoots "wells" which can help you or kill you (although, technically speaking, a watergun can have the same results). Anyway, If this game were on sale I would recommend it.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Interesting concept and regardless (or maybe because) of its simplicity, works well. The controls - which are critical for a game of this type - seem a bit sluggish at times and overall the game lacks polish: for example the level design isn't bad, but somehow it all just looks very...generic and unimaginative. Neither is there a real background story of any kind, leaving you with the feel that you just jump around levels for no reason. The soundtrack catches your attention as you actually at times stop to think how great it is, only to realize it's the same song over and over again. Would really benefit from user-generated content to extend the replay value. Considering the price tag, though, you get the game experience, the trading cards and the achievements, and the game itself isn't critically flawed, so...At this price, recommended for those who like the genre.2/5

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Let it be said first: I do not judge how good a game is by its price. Absurdly cheap prices does NOT a good game make, though I am willing to forgive some of its faults as well as overall length, but a terrible game shall not be forgiven (*cough*AlphaPrime*cough*).So why am I talking about that? Well, besides the absurdly cheap price (only 19 cents!), almost non-existent story and overall game length (1 hour, not counting Hard mode), this is a genuinely good game. In fact, I found it to be very enjoyable, especially with the game's marvelous soundtrack.It's deceptively simple to play, but tough to master. You get your standard 2D platform movement & jumping (with a double-jumping jetpack that recharges mid-air), two types of shots (gravity & anti-gravity pockets) and a shield to protect you from your crazy physics manipulations. Sounds pretty easy, right?And this is where the game's level design really shines. It starts off simple and shows you the ropes, but quite soon after it doesn't hold your hands and you're faced with proper puzzles to solve. You might need to repel yourself to get that extra boost to reach the ledge, or maybe it's not quite enough and you shoot a gravity pocket upwards to attract you and get high enough. Perhaps you'll need to stomp on enemies to get through corridors filled with deadly traps, and you might need to manipulate them too! Gold spinning blades flying towards you? Gold Platforms? Repelling them is usually the best solution. Sometimes you might have permanent shields on, others you might only be able to shoot twice of each shot in mid-air until you recharge on the ground. Needless to say, it keeps things fresh, more than enough for the hour-long experience.If I were to have a major complaint, it would be the lack of variety, and generally every place visually looks about the same except for the backgrounds. Also, your character is severely lacking in animation, so expect very snappy animations when you look around and aim at things. Overall, anyone with a slight interest for physics-based puzzle platformers should definitely try it out.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												Defy Gravity is an original 2D platformer with nice, suitable graphics and great soundtrack. Gameplay brings mixture between puzzle-solving and fast planning/fast reactions, maybe slightly more directed towards the second mentioned.It contains twenty levels with escalating difficulty, most of which are quite challenging, but not frustrating, thanks to well situated check-points (Let level nineteen be the only bad exception).After finishing the game, there is one more playthrough available - hard difficulty - with some removed/added features. I, personally, won´t be playing it, because it´s exactly same levels and it might be insanely difficult at some part (considering feature I used the most is out).Game lacks almost any sort of story, which would have made it even more enjoyable (even few picutres with short narration would be enough). But it´s still pretty amazing and having low price (close-to-theft price during sale) on steam market, there is no other option but highly recommend it.*Played with controller (Keyboard and mouse are OK too)***** 8/10***** 80%

content:

												Surprisingly neat! I made my thirty cents (bought during sale) back from the cards too, so an essentially free, decent game is alright in my books.None of the puzzles are extremely difficult, but some of them do require some timing. There's a hard mode after you beat the game that I didn't really try which could get excrutiating if you're adamant about getting 100% achievements. The physics aren't super finnicky like I'd expect, and it works mostly well. It's a hella indie game though and it shows just from the general lack of polish in areas; there were occasions where I died when I thought I shouldn't have. That's not too big of a deal and I'd say this is definitely worth your money during a sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												Defy Gravity is an original 2D platformer with nice, suitable graphics and great soundtrack. Gameplay brings mixture between puzzle-solving and fast planning/fast reactions, maybe slightly more directed towards the second mentioned.It contains twenty levels with escalating difficulty, most of which are quite challenging, but not frustrating, thanks to well situated check-points (Let level nineteen be the only bad exception).After finishing the game, there is one more playthrough available - hard difficulty - with some removed/added features. I, personally, won´t be playing it, because it´s exactly same levels and it might be insanely difficult at some part (considering feature I used the most is out).Game lacks almost any sort of story, which would have made it even more enjoyable (even few picutres with short narration would be enough). But it´s still pretty amazing and having low price (close-to-theft price during sale) on steam market, there is no other option but highly recommend it.*Played with controller (Keyboard and mouse are OK too)***** 8/10***** 80%

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												An awesome game. Impulsively bought it while it was on special expecting not much.... what a surprise!An interesting mechanic with an adequate learning curve / set of level design.I thought the difficulty was just right. A good challenge but that is never discouraging. You know you'll make it eventually without pulling too many hair out… just a little… just enough.Same for the 2nd walkthrough with only one gravity hole. I'd progressively adapt and have just as much fun in the 2nd play through.Also, the music was surprisingly fitting and very enjoyable.I personally bought this while it was on special, but I wouldn’t of been too upset to have paid the full price. Three dollars for about 3 hours of original gameplay seems fair to me.
